intro: Iridorkis demissa, commonly known as the slender iridorkis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and slender, upright stems that bear small, pale blue or white flowers. Iridorkis demissa typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
